comment.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://open.spotify.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fopen.spotify.com%2F) ### Comment > First off, I already created a GitHub issue and saw that they updated the script, so I updated the filters first (all are up to date now). After a few songs, the page (Spotify) tries to load an advertisement, and then (as seen in the first picture) it goes to an advertisement and crashes the webpage (after I took the picture it crashed, aw snap page for chrome). Username: `@MatthewBeast56` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/awbkia9eqqok8cccksos8kg4kg0ws4gefu3isxzqyg.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/s80zchoy9tcow8s00oggs44ow4gwog0796ki7y7bcw.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Windows v7.15.1 System version: | Windows 11 Browser: | Chrome License type: | paid AdGuard driver: | WFP Stealth mode options: | Hide your search queries,
Send Do-Not-Track header,
Self-destructing third-party cookies (180),
Disable Windows Telemetry,
Turn off Advertising ID DNS filtering: | server: `Cloudfare`, `Malware`, `Protection`
Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base

Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection Userscripts: | AdGuard Extra
AdGuard Popup Blocker
Web of Trust Other extensions used: | n/a
